Package edu.uky.cs.nil.sabre.prog

Class RepeatedRootHeuristic

java.lang.Object
edu.uky.cs.nil.sabre.prog.RepeatedNodeHeuristic
edu.uky.cs.nil.sabre.prog.RepeatedRootHeuristic
All Implemented Interfaces:
ProgressionCost
public class RepeatedRootHeuristic extends RepeatedNodeHeuristic
The repeated root heuristic is similar to the repeated node heuristic, except that it only prevents a heuristic progression search from reusing the same node as a root in the search. Like the repeated root heuristic, this cost function is a wrapper around some other cost function. When a root node (that is, a node whose temporal depth is 0) is evaluated, its cost will be infinity if that node has previously been used as a root at the same temporal level (see the description of the repeated node heuristic). In all other cases, this heursitic passes thru to the cost function it wraps around.
Author:
Stephen G. Ware
